ygData.subject: RE: Clarity and song/spell stacking
ygData.msgSnippet: There are many of these abound. Druid regen must be cast before Hymn of Restoration is used or it will not take hold. Another one that you high level ppl might
ygData.messageBody:
There are many of these abound. Druid regen must be cast before Hymn of
Restoration is used or it will not take hold. Another one that you high
level ppl might or might not know about - Lvl 48 DoT will cause a shaman or
enchanter Yawn Mob spell to not stick while it is in effect(I don't know
what these spells are called, I just say YAWN!) But I have no problem
getting the DoT to stick after they have Yawned the mob. Shaman friend of
mine claims he cannot use quickness on me when my speed songs are in effect,
but an enchanter friend has never complained about that (haven't formally
tested it). It's kinda hard to tell in real-time if all the haste effects
are stacking when you wear a sash, use bard speed attack songs, and have a
quickness type spell on ya (well it is for me). John? =) The icons show
stacked at least.

I would assume that if Chords of Cessation's slowing effect is messing up a
shaman's Yawn, the lvl 20 chords of melodic binding song may do the same?
Again, haven't tested it.

Sartori D'Elsiraad <The Companions>
Bard of Kelethin of the 50th Chorus
Veeshan


>From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Clarity
>Date: Tue, 16 Nov 1999 17:07:26 -0700
>
>I highly suspect this is a bug related to the code that prevents bards from
>being affected by any mana regeneration boosters. Because the bard isn't
>affected when another bard's song pulses it doesn't detect a stacking
>problem because the bard doesn't have the effect on him.
>Another interesting stacking issue I discovered. The yaulp proc'd by the
>screaming mace stacks with Warsong, but not with Anthem, except: If the
>Screaming Mace procs before the anthem you get both effects. If it procs
>after Anthem is already up you get the your "spell did not take effect"
>message and the Yaulp does not stick. I thought that was odd as it was the
>only order related stacking I had ever encountered.
>That led me to question some of the apparent Hymn stacking we considered
>long ago. If a bard's song only checks on the opposing bard for stacking
>which seems to be true, could two bards in the same group stand outside
>each
>other's area of effect but both having and intermediary person inside both
>their areas of effect. If they did would the person in both areas be
>healed
>doubly? Something to check. I know for sure that while I cannot play Hymn
>if a higher level bard is, if I walk away from his area of effect I can
>play
>it even though we are in the same group. Something for someone with good
>analysis techniques like John (tm) to check.
>
> Kitasi
>
